column4: I have been using Ubuntu now for 9 months and I still can't get my SATA Optical Drive to work
Dr_Willis, I know, but I've had one now for about 2 years
It workd out of the box back when I was running Windows....
Spheard, I hear that...I would still love to have this drive working
Spheard, it's 7.04 and it's just the sata optical drive...all of my other SATA drives work
if you don't want to solve your problem, suit yourself
it's unlikely that this will enable sound across the network
no it's not since it won't do sound this way
I know, but there are also remote access sound servers which I'm googling up for someone unwilling to google themselves.
nmapping from inside his LAN won't help a bit
That's why he should do an nmap of the WAN address....it's been a while since I have messed with any of that stuff though
he cannot do a nmap of that cause no matter what he will reach the router throught he lAN interface
